baseline_groups.claim_summary: Child marriage bans (cohort exposure x regional pre-ban intensity) reduce child marriage rates in 17 low- and middle-income countries
baseline_groups.notes: Generalized DiD (TWFE) with countryage + countryregionurban FE, CRV1 clustered at countryregionurban. Primary baseline is childmarriage outcome (Table4-PanelA-Col1, coef=-0.0077, p=0.003). Three additional baselines use alternative outcomes from same table: marriage_age (Col2, coef=+0.123, p=0.009), educ (Col4, coef=+0.045, p=0.023), employed (Col5, coef=-0.009, p=0.002). All four are explicitly listed in the surface as baseline specs. The alternative-outcome baselines change the outcome concept but are part of the paper's multi-outcome claim object.

global_notes: Surface-driven run. One baseline group (G1) matching the pre-run surface. One surface-planned spec was not executed: rc/controls/add/interviewyear_banyear_fe. No spurious groups or baseline-group reassignments needed. All 50 rows succeeded. Inference variants (8 rows) correctly placed in inference_results.csv, not in specification_results.csv.
